intro: Triumfetta benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
